channel.title: Hmm, little save issue. Static refrence crap
channel.description:
I have an int in client: public int usedCharScreen = 0;
I have something that makes it != 1.
I am trying to make it save but it's default thing is class player, I know this because in the ()'s it says (Player plr) and all int's etc that are being saved have a .plr. Anyway, heres my save code:
[code] characterfile.write("usedCharScreen = ", 0, 17); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(client.usedCharScreen), 0, Integer.toString(client.usedCharScreen).length()); characterfile.newLine(); [/code] When I try to compile I get this: [code] .\PlayerHandler.java:379: non-static variable usedCharScreen cannot be referenced from a static context characterfile.write(Integer.toString(client.usedCharScreen), 0, Integer.toString(client.usedCharScreen).length()); ^ .\PlayerHandler.java:379: non-static variable usedCharScreen cannot be referenced from a static context characterfile.write(Integer.toString(client.usedCharScreen), 0, Integer.toString(client.usedCharScreen).length()); ^ 2 errors [/code] So my question is how would you get it to link to client? Or I will just have to make a whole new file but I do not want to do that.
